results.title: Prediction problem
results.creator_credit: Katie Jennings and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Fire on the rim”.
Careful planning with technological innovation can minimise the damage and death caused by seismic activity. The education of peoples in lands around the “ring of fire” also assists in avoiding unnecessary disaster. Although scientists can make intelligent guesses about the movement of the earth, the predicition of earthquakes and eruptions remains an imperfect art. The study of historical evidence coupled with intensive research around the Pacific Rim, is helping to gain a clearer picture of the problem.

results.title: Predator (10th Anniversary Double Pack)
results.creator_credit: Joel Silver and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Predator: Dutch, (Arnold Schwarzenneger) a military special forces operative, is sent on a covert rescue mission to a Latin American country. After fighting off a team of local guerrillas, Dutch’s own team start to get picked off, by a deadly inhuman force. Deep in the rainforest the camouflaged predator is soon on Dutch’s tail - whose skills and deadly cunning make him a worthy match for the stealth of the monster. “Predator” is an action movie with traits typical of the science fiction/action genre: throwaway lines, fast moving suspense sequences and insurmountable odds for the hero. “Predator 2”: The setting for the sequel is the urban jungle of downtown LA. A detective and his crew are baffled by a series of gruesome murders of local drug dealers. An FBI officer warns the team off further investigation, which of course only strengthens the resolve of the team. When part of his own posse is murdered, the detective uncovers the awful truth - the monstrous villain of the original film is back. Like the original, the sequel relies heavily on special effects and action to entertain, this time with Danny Glover in the lead role.

results.title: Predation of cossid moth larvae by yellow-tailed black cockatoos
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Shows how the yellow-tailed black cockatoo extracts cossid moth larvae from the trunks of eucalypts and covers other aspects of the behaviour of the bird and its prey, emphasizing the role of evolutionary adaptation. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Precision echo sounding
results.creator_credit: Basic Films and R.K. Neilson Baxter
results.brief_description: Covers in detail the method of making sea surveys using precision echo sounding, contrasting old-fashioned methods with the remarkable accuracy and efficiency of echo-sounding.

results.title: Precision aikido 3
results.creator_credit: Michael Field and Kiko Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: Precision Aikido 3 summarises and expands on Precision Aikido 2. Provides detailed “How to do it” instructions for Aikido’s third, fourth, fifth and sixth locking and pinning techniques (Sankyo and Yonkyo Omote and Ura Wazas plus Gokyo and Rokyo Wazas), 37 variations in total. Includes demonstrations of techniques from all other Aikido technical catagories. Ideal for students and instructors of Aikido. Please note: this program has ongoing timer at the top of the screen.

results.title: Precision aikido 2
results.creator_credit: Kiko Pty Ltd and Michael Field
results.brief_description: Precision Aikido 2 reviews and expands on Precision Aikido 1. Provides detailed “How to do it” instructions for Aikido’s first and second locking and pinning techniques (Ikkyo and Nikyo Omote and Ura Wazas), 28 variations in total. Includes demonstrations of techniques from all the other Aikido technical catagories. Ideal for students and instructors of Aikido. Please note: this program has an ongoing timer at the top of the screen.

results.title: Precision aikido 1
results.creator_credit: Michael Field, Kiko Pty Ltd, Field Aikido Centre and Stephen Fitchett
results.brief_description: Sensei Michael Field, presents the Japanese martial art of Aikido in a totally unique manner. It is a suitable complimentary program for those attending classes. Beginners will appreciate the attention to detail and lucidity of the explanations of Aikido technique. Instructors will find a genuinely useful tool to assist in communicating to their students the intricacies of the art. Illustrates detailed “how to do it” instructions for Aikido’s manouevring system (Tai Sabaki), extension method techniques and practices (Kokyo Hoo), introduction to the first locking and pinning techniques (Ikkyo Omote and Ura Wazas) and entering throws (Irimi Nage). Demonstrates techniques from all the other Aikido technical categories.

results.title: Precision
results.creator_credit: Jacques Bobet, ONF | NFB and Georges Dufaux
results.brief_description: Here is the famed Royal Canadian Mounted Police Musical Ride, filmed in a way that gives it all the unison of a chorus line. An extremely sophisticated exercise in patterned movement of horses and riders, the Musical Ride entails pinpoint precision. In this film the camera challenges this virtuosity from every angle, including a position directly above the platoon. The resulting blend of music, color, movement and, of course, fine horsemanship, is exciting to see. (Awards: Locarno)
